raw_text: The patient is complaining from bilateral knee pain since five years. Two years ago, the pain increased. Plane X-ray was done showing advanced osteoarthritis grade 4. Non-steroidal anti-inflammatory was given for around one month with muscle relaxants showing mild improvement. She is now doing physiotherapy exercises to see again after two weeks.

Non-steroidal anti-inflammatory was given for around one month with muscle relaxants showing mild improvement. She is now doing physiotherapy exercises to see again after two weeks.

json_data.history_of_illness: The patient has been experiencing bilateral knee pain for five years, with an increase in pain two years ago.
json_data.current_medication: Non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drugs and muscle relaxants
json_data.imaging_results: Plane X-ray showing advanced osteoarthritis grade 4
json_data.plan: Continue physiotherapy exercises, follow up after two weeks

reasoning: The patient is complaining of bilateral knee pain for five years, which is a chronic condition. The pain increased two years ago, indicating a progression of the condition. The diagnosis of advanced osteoarthritis grade 4 is based on the X-ray findings. The patient was initially treated with non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drugs and muscle relaxants, showing mild improvement. The current plan involves continuing physiotherapy exercises and a follow-up after two weeks to assess further progress.
